txt.en: The Orcs have taken over Ânghumu-ru and have been using the forges to craft weapons. If the forges are disabled, the Orcs' craft will be slowed.
The Orcs have taken over Ânghumu-ru and have been using the forges to craft weapons. If the forges are disabled, the Orcs' craft will be slowed.
Forges can be found in Ânghumu-ru in the north-west quadrant of the Flaming Deeps.\n\nYou should disable the forges to hinder the weapon-craft of the Ghâsh-hai.
The forges of Ânghumu-ru are disabled, and the Orcs will now be hindered in their crafting of new weapons.
Forges can be found in Ânghumu-ru in the north-west quadrant of the Flaming Deeps.\n\nYou should disable the forges to hinder the weapon-craft of the Ghâsh-hai.
The forges of Ânghumu-ru are disabled, and the Orcs will now be hindered in their crafting of new weapons.
'Without knowing what the Ghâsh-hai are planning, we cannot determine if we need to launch an assault against them.'

'These maps are troublesome. It appears the Ghâsh-hai leaders have decided to ally with the forces of Mazog. They are planning a flank assault on the forces of Mordor in the Twenty-first Hall.

'While this might seem a benefit to us, Mazog's army greatly outnumbers the forces Mordor has dispatched here. If Mordor is eliminated quickly, we can only suffer. The conflict between Mordor and Moria must be forced to last as long as possible.

'We must find a way to shift their allegiance and have them side with Mordor, but how, I do not yet know.'
